meanings.definition: a deity to whom children were sacrificed in ancient Semitic religions.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people believed in molochs and offered sacrifices to them.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists discovered an altar dedicated to molochs in the ruins.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully pretended to offer their toys to the imaginary molochs.
meanings.sent4: The greedy corporation was described as a molochs devouring the resources of the land.
meanings.sent5: The legend warned of the molochs lurking in the shadows, waiting for unsuspecting victims.

meanings.definition: a large, fierce, and cruel person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The dragon in the story was portrayed as a molochs terrorizing the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The storm unleashed its fury like a molochs wreaking havoc on the town.
meanings.sent3: The bully at school acted like a molochs, intimidating everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The old abandoned house stood tall like a molochs in the desolate landscape.
meanings.sent5: The dictator ruled with an iron fist, earning the reputation of a molochs among the people.
